messages.message:
I've been playing around with the 'custom function' feature in Build. There are couple of quality of life additions that I would've liked:
1. I don't understand the 'context' argument passed. The docs didn't seem to provide much guidance on this. As far as I can tell the difference between `context` and `context['document text']` is only formatting. Can anyone provide some clarification?
2. There are no 'save changes'/'discard' buttons - you can only back out using the nested menu at the top
3. If you have an error in your validation custom function code, the validation result is printed as 'Fail' (see screenshot). This is no different from the case where your code is valid, but the validation test fails (apart from error message printed in the logs). I think the result should be stated as 'error', and even better if the line of code creating the error can be highlighted in red or something

The context object is supposed to contain all the things you would be able to access as part of the custom function about the documents you’re processing. Right now it only contains document text. Is there anything else you’d suggest that you might want to use in a custom function that is not there currently?

Does this mean it contains all the text digitally read from the document, so that you can validate using data contained somewhere else in the document, even if you are not extracting them as a field? At the moment when I print the context it contains some of the document's text but not all of it
I think the text might just be limited to the last bit of document data - but doesn't provide all the document text

That’s right, `context['document_text']` contains all the text in the document for you to reference in the custom function.

However print statements are currently limited to 4KB in size so if you want to see all the text you’ll have to split the text into multiple print statements
yes like Danny said, if you print the document, due to the log limit, it’ll get truncated
Great - makes sense. Thanks for clearing that up!

2. There is a “Save and run” button at the bottom - does that button not appear for you?
3. cc @Elan Sharony to provide more details on the expected pass/fail behavior for validation UDFs
I can only see a run code button. It seems that when I press the run code button I can very quickly see a save and run button that then disappears once the run is finished
Assuming this was on aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com), the update to make “Save and run” appear on any change has not made it prod, but has been addressed!
